title: Darn Frog
content:
Has anybody heard about the FREAKING ANNOYING Jamster ringtone in UK that took Speed of Sound (which is a very good song) out of the #1 spot on the Billboard Top 100? This is making me lose my faith in Sweden. Anyways, Djaser, you have him as something in your signature - what do you have to do with this really, really annoying ringtone? Personally, i hate them all, but this one is above the rest.------------------------------------
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Q90]click here to see something interesting (PLEASE!!!!!!!!)[/url]
The NEW
[url=http://qsilver90.com][img]http://qsilver90.com/images/logos/logo1.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Darn Frog
content:
Ah, someone who shares my pain. There are commercials for various Jamster ringtones where I live, and they get played so much that I deeply loathe the song on them (which is called Crazy Frog Remix or something...). I just heard yesterday about the ringtone being released on c.d or whatever and actually taking a spot on a music chart (let along number one...). This pleases so many of my friends...

Perhaps if the song wasn't everywhere, I wouldn't despise it so much. But I don't think that will be anytime soon...[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Darn Frog
content:
Lucky me - I don't watch TV. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] (Except the Simpsons and the occasional DVD)

I know some guy on my bus who has every single Crazy Frog song and ringtone. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] I can't quite understand why he likes them, but now I sit away from him because he kept trying to lend me his Crazy Frog CD. Crazy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]

title: Re: Darn Frog
content:
The noise it makes is somewhat funny the first time, but listening to it over and over again gets annoying fast. I remember hearing it first as a background to the [url=http://funnyjunk.com/pages/insanity_test.htm]Insanity Test[/url] on Funnyjunk. Quite how Jamster has become so successful is a mystery - I guess it's because people like random stupid things ([url=http://badgerbadgerbadger.com]Badger Badger Badger[/url] is a good example of this).

title: Re: Darn Frog
content:
A few of those sounds used by ringtone manufacturers are just ripped from internetsites, maybe all of them are.
If you ask me, every single one of them is as annoying as heck.
For lunch sometimes I go to a snackbar with my colleagues where they have on MTV or TMF non-stop, and I think about 30% of what I see is commercials for those annoying ring tones, usually with a movie of some animal that seems to have absolutely nothing to do with the ring tone.

There must be gazillions of Euros/Dollars going on in that business, along with the many people sending expensive SMSs to polls on TV only to skip "Yes" and "No", and vote they have no opinion on the subject.
I just don't get it...Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

content:

Oh and sorry Q90 I didn't see this:

Like I already said I really really like the frog. Last month I bought a mobile phone with a Jamster subscription. I can't say I regret doing so.-----------------

title: Re: Darn Frog
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Wrong, they paid royalties.[hr][/quote]

I'm glad to hear that.

[quote]Quote:[hr]You don't like nice ringtones and wallpapers on your mobile phone?[hr][/quote]

I don't even personally own a mobile phone, but I got one from work, which I use.
I'm not supposed to use it unless it's for work, so it's usually just the getting called, not the calling. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Anyway, it's a relatively basic thing, so only monotone ringtones.

Anyway, I would've personalised my phone a bit if I could, but I'd choose a wallpaper, a ringtone, I suppose another for people in my address book and all that, but that's that.
It seems the ringtone business is thriving of youngsters getting something new every week.
Maybe I'm just misreading things, but if I'm not, I simply don't get it.

I know for a fact some people spend waaaaaaaay too much on their phone through SMS'ing.
Not just their friends, but also game shows, forum-like things on TV channels, anything.
I'm not quite sure I like that kind of development.
Oh well, just my opinion, everybody is responsible for his or himself, and should do whatever pleases him or her.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Murrrgh.
content:
I'm in the 'don't get it' boat on this one. I can never understand how people can spend so much money on such mainstream junk. If I had a colour-screened mobile that could play WAV/MIDI (I'd much prefer MOD, though), I wouldn't waste that kind of technology on pre-fab garbage... and I certainly wouldn't pay for the 4kb of data it takes up when all I'd need to do is copy a freakin' file from Game Music\Commander Keen across a USB cord!

I rarely watch TV these days, for the very reason that it's overloaded with reality TV and inane commercials, so I'm thankfully uneducated about the 'Jamster!' phenomenon... I have noticed the ad a couple of times, but I somehow manage to tune out.

[hr]Djaser Last month I bought a mobile phone with a Jamster subscription.
[hr]Subscription...? What exactly is there to subscribe to? I don't get it...Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"You are so afraid to live--so afraid of life itself--that you've given up the very nature of your being in trade for security."
-CWG Book 3, Neale Donald Walsh

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]
